definition: to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: You'll never be happy if you spend all your time goofing off.
sentences.chinese: 如果你整天吊儿郎当，你永远不会快乐。
别整天吊儿郎当无所事事。

sentences.english: He never does any work, he just fools around all day long.
sentences.chinese: 他从来不干什么工作，整天吊儿郎当的。

sentences.english: The village cadre said they did not do productive work, they just fooled around.
sentences.chinese: 村干部说他们不好好生产，吊儿郎当。

sentences.english: Organizers were determined not to be bums.
sentences.chinese: 组织者下决心不让人成为吊儿郎当的流浪汉。

sentences.english: I can not stand irresponsible guys like him.
sentences.chinese: 像他那种吊儿郎当的人，我实在受不了。

definition: to trifle without respect (idiom); to despise worldly conventions/frivolous
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
see 嬉皮笑臉|嬉皮笑脸[xi1 pi2 xiao4 lian3]
not care about one's appearance (idiom)/slovenly in dress and manner
